title: Weekly Mental Health Discussion Thread
selftext:
Is there anything that you want to get off your chest? Heartbreak, abuse, depression, sorrow, career or education related, behavioural changes? Share it and discuss it here.

You may find someone who has gone through a similar episode and might be able to help/guide you.

Please be civil and maintain Reddiquette while participating or replying/helping out someone.

You can also join our [Discord](https://discord.gg/6V29X7f) to discuss this, we have a separate channel (#wellness) exclusively for this topic.

**If you need support or know someone who does, please Reach Out to Your Nearest Mental Health Specialist**.

* **Helplines**: AASRA: 91-22-27546669 (24 hours)
* **Sneha Foundation**: 91-44-24640050 (24 hours)
* **Vandrevala Foundation for Mental Health**: 1860-2662-345 and 1800-2333-330 (24 hours)
* **iCall**: 9152987821 (Available from Monday to Saturday: 8:00am to 10:00pm)
* **Connecting NGO**: 18002094353 (Available from 12 pm - 8 pm)

**Mental Health Thread is posted every Wednesday morning |** [**Old Threads**](https://www.reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Mental+Discussion&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/1fqd80djw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=184ead1efd5057f53cc3236ab564a2ce3ac8a7f6
comments:
Today one of my managers, escalated to senior management again. After me telling the management how she bullies people and screams and shouts and causes anxiety in the team due to which several of my colleagues have left the project quietly. 

I refused to go quietly so I escalated it further and said I won’t work on this project anymore because it is impacting my mental health now. Let’s see what happens.

My mental health is a joke. Just like me. I have severe OCD (not that kiddie trypophobia jokes again please) and its making my life hell. CBT and ERP involve facing fears but I cant even make a small change. Its verry hard. Meds dont work. I fear everything(like someone is watching me, that I will go to jail if I talk to someone wrongly, that I will be killed if I dont wash my hands with three different soaps)

Long distance sucks. It makes me sadder. We know we have to separate but one of us ends up calling after some months anyways. I was better when I was not dating at all. Also sucks that i am a little underweight but my head is so big, it looks weird especially with my hairline receding in my early 20s. Father's advice of padhega likhega banega mahan khelega kudega hoga kharab isn't true. I got a job but half of my body now hurts and feels weak and i can't sit for long and the job requires sitting for really long hours. Got hunched back. I wish I had been more physically active. Everything is so costly. Went to the govt medical hospital doctors so ignorant. He heard three lines gave a prescription with daily injections in my waist. No way I'm taking that.
Do you want to share publicly how old you are? and how much distance?
Are you getting professional help?
Hang in strong. DM me if you want help.
I try but meds dont work. I am resistant to them. And I am ashamed to share my thoughts with the therapist and the therapist is in another city so no good therapists near me
23, banglore and Jaipur
The last line seems like beginning of psychosis. See a psychiatrist.
I am seeing psychiatrists. I have changed 5 of them till now. Nothing helps. No meds work.
Have you tried antipsychotics?
Some of my meds are antipsychotics I think. They are used in treatment of schizophrenias right?
Yes. Which ones have you tried till now?

Oh man I have tried like 20 pages worth of prescription changes. I will need to check all of them and which ones are antipsychotics. Any other way you can help me please tell. Psychiatrist or psychologist recommendation. Even a city where there are good therapists , psychiatrist  or something works.
Do you have negative symptoms like anhedonia, depressed mood etc?

I have OCD,Depression and Social Anxiety all officially diagnosed. I have comorbid symptoms as the therapist explained and anhedonia,ADHD,brain fog and similar also exist. I also have psychotic rage issues. I self harm with blunt force to my head using punches and objects. I break stuff , last time I broke a glass and bloodied my hand. Man its hell

Oh I’m sorry for you. You can try to get low dose Amisulpride (25mg). It increases dopamine at lower doses and helps me significantly with the motivation issues. I have tried many meds in the past and nothing beats Amisulpride. It does have side effects like increased prolactin but nothing dangerous.

Thanks but I would rather take meds with professional guidance. Tapering off meds make me go crazy. Changing meds make me go crazy. I will keep it in mind. I still look for the best psychiatrist in India but I dont know where they are
Ask your psychiatrist about Amisulpride specifically for dysthymia / negative symptoms. BTW where do you live?

Every second person is obsessed with "Big D package" of a random person. For example, I was on a vacation in North East of India, and I met people in a cafe and I was shocked when they started to collect my biodata. Why should I be interested in knowing what do you do, what "package size" do you have, are you a engineering manager or chola samosa? Then I wondered that's why Indians are so frustrated with their lives and they will go to limits to become a frustrated person. After that incident, I just stopped talking to people whereas in the background I heard about people discussing about IT, marriage plan, girl lafda at 12000ft. What? Yes.

Ask your Dr to change the meds. 

Also you should NEVER be ashamed to share your thoughts with your therapist.

Only if you open up will she be able to help you
You listed many issues. Which is your biggest issue?
Madhya Pradesh . Tier 2 city
Is Nagpur is near to you? I know a good doctor there.

Yeah

do tell

Dr. Vivek Kirpekar (He treated me few months ago, decent doctor) 
Dr. Sudhir Bhave (Heard good things about him too)
Thanks
You might want to try neuro modulation if drugs and therapy aren't helping. Also therapy is hard and takes a lot of resolve to challenge your thoughts.
Off topic but do u think anti-depressants are effective?

Trials have consistently shown that they're better than placebo. What is important is the proper diagnosis and intervention needs to be tailored to the patient. Some might do better with therapy and some might benefit more with medication or both.
